title : dynamic client registration
description : the dynamic client registration api provides operations to register and manage client applications for use with la banque postale's oauth 2.0 and openid connect endpoints. this api largely follows the contract defined in rfc7591: oauth 2.0 dynamic client registration protocol and openid connect dynamic client registration 1.0. note that clients managed via this api are modeled as applications in la banque postale and appear in the apps section of the administrator ui. changes made via the api appear in the ui and vice versa. tokens issued by these clients follow the rules for access tokens and id tokens.
endpoints : 
  - post /register
    add a new client application to your account
  - get /register/{client_id}
    retrieve an existing client application of your account with all its details
  - delete /register/{client_id}
    remove a client application from your account

thinking process: the provided description encompasses various functionalities like client registration, retrieval, and deletion. it follows the oauth 2.0 and openid connect standards for dynamic client registration.

title: simplivpnapi

description: simplivpnapi is a web service that manages vpn (virtual private network) users and servers. it provides endpoints for user registration, login, enabling/disabling users, obtaining server summaries, retrieving server details, and checking if a username is available.

endpoints:
1. post /disable-user
   disableuser: this endpoint disables a specified user account.

2. post /enable-user
   enableuser: this endpoint enables a specified user account.

3. post /login
   login: this endpoint initiates the authentication process for a user.

4. post /register
   register: this endpoint registers a new user account.

5. get /server-summaries
   serversummaries: this endpoint returns a list of summary information about all available vpn servers.

6. get /servers
   servers: this endpoint returns detailed information about all available vpn servers.

7. post /username-available
   usernameavailable: this endpoint checks if a specified username is available for registration.

- get /loans/{loanid}/repayment: get a loan repayment history

- get /loans/{loanid}: get a specific loan application
- patch /loans/{loanid}: approve a loan application
- patch /users/{usermail}/verify: verify a user

title: xero bank feeds api
description: the bank feeds api is a closed api specifically designed for financial institutions that have established a financial services partnership with xero. it offers capabilities to search for and manage feed connections, retrieve statements, and create or update statements.
endpoints:

1. get /feedconnections
searches for feed connections.
2. post /feedconnections
creates one or more new feed connections.
3. post /feedconnections/deleterequests
delete an existing feed connection.
4. get /feedconnections/{id}
retrieve single feed connection based on a unique id provided.
5. get /statements
retrieve all statements.
6. post /statements
creates one or more new statements.
7. get /statements/{statementid}
retrieve single statement based on unique id provided.

thinking: this api seems to focus on retrieving and managing bank statements for financial institutions. it's useful for financial institutions who require automated access to financial data.

title : investments api
description :
the investments api allows customers to initialize, execute, and manage their investments, from account to account.
endpoints :
- post /investments
  allows users to initiate an investment from an account.
- put /investments/{key}/execute
  allows users to execute the initialized investment identified by 'key'.
- get /investments/me
  retrieves the customer's list of investments.
- get /investments/me/{investment-key}
  retrieves the customer's detailed information for the specified investment.
- put /investments/me/{investment-key}
  updates the user's instructions for a particular investment.
- get /investments/funds/me
  fetches the user's investment funds.
<thinking>
the api has three main functionalities - creating, modifying, and listing investments. it also allows customers to access and manage their investment funds. the api endpoints allow users to interact with the investment system in various ways.
</thinking>

title : session management
description :
      manages user sessions, including authentication, session management, and user data retrieval
endpoints :
    - post /vue/auth/login
      authenticate and initiate a new session
    - delete /vue/auth/logout
      terminate the current session
    - get /vue/auth/verify
      verify and refresh user authentication
